page.title: 03ECOLOGY OF ARKENGARTHDALE
page.content: This block is unspoilt by pollution and is conserved by the efforts of the {North Yorkshire Dales National Park.} There are many varieties of wild flowers.These grow on the moorland, meadows and pasture, in and around the woodland and along the river-side. Some of the hillsides are rough,wild and bleak.Most of the rocky outcrops are natural.There are many footpaths and bridleways across our area.Some of the paths are very old and are called 'green tracks'.They are between 1metre and 3metres wide and are often bounded by dry stone walls on each side. These were old pack horse routes. The weather can be severe in winter. The snow comes earlier, lies deeper and stays longer than in lower regions.The extra height gives a lower temperature.The height of the school is 286metres above sea level.
